title: What goods European countries want more from Indian export? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to find out what goods European countries want more from India, let’s do some market research. Studying the market trend of products and see what are in demand or expected to grow high in demand. Let me give you few examples in agricultural and food sector. India is ranked 2nd in sesame seed export, taking up 15.60% of the global export market. In 2016, India exported $435.9M value of sesame seeds.  *Note: the top export destinations of sesame seeds from India As you can see from the graph, India exports sesame seeds to European countries including Greece, Germany, Netherlands, Russia, Poland and United Kingdom. Moreover, India has been one of the forerunners in the global sesame market. And the market of sesame seeds is likely to grow for the forecasted period of 2018-2024, with Europe growing as the newly rising market. The growth of sesame seeds import in Europe is noteworthy, with the import rate increasing 3% annually. The rise in import was triggered by challenges faced by European suppliers in producing adequate sesame seeds. In 2016, imports of sesame seeds in Europe have grown to approximately 155 thousand tonnes. From this market trend, we can induce that European countries would likely to increase sesame seed imports from India. India is also ranked 10 in exporting soya beans, with export value of $114.8M USD. They export their soya beans to Belgium, Germany, France, and Spain. Have a look at the graph.  *Note: the top export destinations of soya beans from India Soybean is high in protein, which makes it suitable for animal feed. About 98% of soybean meal is consumed by livestock. The demand for soybean increased worldwide due to the active livestock sector and expanded cultivation acreage. Especially with the increasing number of vegans and vegetarians who are looking for meat substitute in European countries, demand in soybeans would surely rise.
